results.project_location: 1414 S 500th W Salt Lake City, UT 84115

results.short_description: This office furniture is some of our favorites and truly one of a kind.
results.project_copy:
Colmena is a Utah based real estate development company who has recently moved their office into a nearby neighborhood and wanted a local artisan touch inside. Working with M3LD designer Andrea Beecher, we set off to design and build some of our most ambitious pieces yet. The idea was to have a modern feel with crisp white walls, concrete floor, and a highlight of elegant, quality furniture.

Below are some photos of the reception desk, plans table, multifunctional workstation, and rolling accent tables. As you enter you are greeted by the reception desk, which wraps around ample storage cabinetry with an abstract slab of chiseled marble that meets at the corner. From there, you can see the plans table which is a large upside down "U" design that is part walnut and part steel for discussing blue prints on one side and fixing lunch on the other. We wanted to represent their brand logo, so we had hexagons laser cut out of thick steel and hand laid them into the wood to create a fading effect.

The multifunctional workstation was one of the highlighted areas. Aabir of the Colmena Group wished to have a large conference table layout that could also be usable as several private areas for people to work. Removable planter boxes gave this table the ability to be transformed. Running across the top is a fixed box laced with sufficient USB, HDMI, and power outlets to handle modern professional devices. The two rolling walnut accent tables have power outlets to make them useable anywhere in the office. If you are interested in setting up a unique space that caters to your brand and creative work style, email info@projectsunday.net to set up a meeting with our design team.
results.blockquote_text: The multifunctional workstation was one of the highlighted areas. Aabir of the Colmena Group wished to have a large conference table layout that could also be usable as several private areas for people to work.

results.short_description: Quality furniture and design to compliment this dining experience.
results.project_location: 1457 East 3350 South, Salt Lake City, UT
results.project_copy: 2016 was the year of design and fabrication on Table X. A restaurant founded by three young, ambitious chefs looking to create a one of a kind Utah dining experience. Project Sunday was commissioned to build the dining tables, wood cabinetry, collaboration staircase, and the famed 'Table X' communal table in back. Everything carefully planned, designed, and cooked from scratch.

results.short_description: Not your typical residential library shelving.
results.project_copy: The ladies at J Squared Interiors design inspiring spaces for clients within the Park City area. We worked with one of the principal designers, Jenny Samuelson to build this custom shelving unit for her personal home. We used steel round tubing and reclaimed oak from the eastern US to make a beautifully functional piece for her book collection. This style has become an oft requested Project Sunday staple. Email info@projectsunday.net.

results.short_description: Retail Store and barber shop build to honor rugged beards and heritage men's clothing.
results.project_copy: In Salt Lake City, there are few men's clothing stores that stack up to the curated men's fashion and interior design of Curriculum. We used reclaimed oak, glass, and steel to create a dim, moody environment which uniquely showcases their merchandise and augments the sophisticated atmosphere they've created for The Barbershop. It is our belief that the finishes and furniture in a retail store matter just as much as the goods themselves. Email info@projectsunday.net to set up a commercial interior design consultation.

results.short_description: Visit the Project Sunday designed retail store at the Summit of Snowbird.
results.project_copy: Snowbird is a key vacation destination in Utah. One of the major ski/summer resorts in the area has been looking to take things up a notch to compete with Vail. 2015 called for establishing territory at the top of the Tram line with a brand new building for travelers to eat, shop, and view the Wasatch Range. Riley Ridd (also known for interior design seen at Riverhorse on Main in PC) had the unique privilege of leading our team in building their retail store. The shelving was created with adjustability in mind with reclaimed oak and patina treated steel. The granite counter top with a waterfall edge on the oak cash wrap and credenza was designed to echo the striking canyon walls that surround the resort. Riley was able to bring to life, her one of a kind steel and sapele mannequins in tandem with the deft hands of metal worker, Charlie Kimball of Element Shopworks. The store may only be 400 square feet, but we think it says a little something that its 11,000 feet up. Email info@projectsunday.net to set up commercial or residential interior design consultations.
results.blockquote_text: The shelving was created with adjustability in mind with reclaimed oak and patina treated steel. The granite counter top with a waterfall edge on the oak cash wrap and credenza was designed to echo the striking canyon walls that surround the resort.

results.short_description: Residential design without boundaries.
results.project_copy: The houses nestled into Columbus Court overlooking the Utah State Capitol Building are elegant with modern layouts, tall ceilings, large patios, and picturesque window viewpoints. We teamed up once again with M3LD's Andrea Beecher to assist in the design and build of one of these homes. Each of the three floors were to have a different and very specific theme. The main level received patina steel treatments which made the house seem to be constructed of heavy industrial beams, bolts, and metal.  We worked to incorporate a shelving design that would showcase his home sound system as well as accentuate a vivid Detroit alleyway mural. By using leftover flooring planks and matching the wood and stain, the shelving seems to be an extension of the floor with the stereo equipment floating in thin air. Downstairs was developed into a traveling circus caravan. The bar area was transformed with a full-wall mirror mosaic and leather strap suspended wooden shelving. Custom curtain rods on each interior doorway added a unique feeling of privacy when drawn. Upstairs, the 40 foot long northern wall and foyer was textured with two tones of wood, to echo the style of his platform bed. The office found its completion with bent, adjustable shelving, as well as a 10 foot long daybed with storage cabinets underneath. The entryway beams were wrapped in patina steel to bring the flow of the outside in. Email info@projectsunday.net to turn your own residential interior design projects into reality.
results.blockquote_text: The houses nestled into Columbus Court overlooking the Utah State Capitol Building are elegant with modern layouts, tall ceilings, large patios, and picturesque window viewpoints.

results.short_description: Reclaimed Oak Fireplace and Mantle.
results.project_copy: This modern home, built in 2014, needed some rustic flavor so the owner asked us to add reclaimed oak to the entire 30 feet of chimney surround and build a mantlepiece above the fireplace. We used the same style for the entryway ceiling. Texture wood is a a quick, inexpensive way to add some sex appeal to a space whether big or small. Email info@projectsunday.net if you're looking to add texture to your walls.

results.short_description: An industrial creative workspace delivering top of the line web design and brand styling.
results.project_copy: Super Top Secret is not technically classified information. These guys offer corporate branding and web design for some very well known clients. We sought out STS to work on our website and in return, they asked to have unique office furniture built. Each piece was intended to represent their brand with highlighted function, form, and quality. The reception desk is a multi pitch steel/wood combination that includes an LED lit clear acrylic "Super Top Secret" logo. Their war room was in need of a conference table with a more edgy design. We had a CNC cut an angular piece of metal which houses the power source for devices, conference phones, and HDMI into the solid oak tabletop. The owners weren't satisfied with the original mishmash of tables and appliances lining the kitchen wall. What we created was something much more refined where they could congregate, cook, host parties and clients. Oak cabinetry with under mount LED lighting, white oak countertops, and a metal/wood kitchen island accompanied by Harlem Stools, all helped shape up their creative workspace. As you can see, we both benefited from the relationship.
results.blockquote_text: Each piece was intended to represent their brand with highlighted function, form, and quality. The reception desk is a multi pitch steel/wood combination that includes an LED lit clear acrylic "Super Top Secret" logo. Their war room was in need of a conference table with a more edgy design.

results.project_copy: Client and friend, Jared Armstrong, knew he needed something to accentuate his fireplace. He's a fellow motorcyclist whom appreciates vintage style. We helped to design a custom fireplace facade that included a built in TV console which fit his look rather nicely. If you're looking to add a bit of flare to an existing room or want help creating a certain style, email info@projectsunday.net for a design consultation.

results.short_description: Handmade walnut benches, custom office with murphy bed, all wood sectional, and more.
results.project_headline: Won't find these on a showroom floor.
results.project_copy: Promontory is one of those neighborhoods that is all class. Spacious plots, incredible views, eclectic homes. Cody Derrick and Lauren Bald at Cityhome Collective hired us to get some ideas flowing at this palatial estate. The pictures below will show what we came up with. Walking in the front door, you are greeted by two beautifully long walnut benches with minimal hairpin legs. Stepping down the few steps into the open floor plan, you can see three of Utah's ski resorts straight ahead, and to your left and right two floating Project Sunday benches. The benches, built without leg supports are all cleverly engineered with strong sub structures that secure firmly to the walls. The solid walnut sectional with adjustable brass shelving running from the back to the ceiling is a favorite of ours and just through the kitchen area. Cityhome had us fabricate the all wood body of this piece, then they adorned it with a cushy pad and pillows to soften it up a bit. Underneath are several large storage drawers for children's toys and blankets when the snow starts to fall. The office space is truly unique. The owners asked if we could turn it into a part time guest room. We built a fully custom Murphy Bed, three sided perimeter desk with filing cabinets, and a standing closet which fully transformed the room. Outside on the luxurious patio overlooking Park City, Utah, we built long banquet tables out of Sapele which tuck up against their existing handrails and columns. Overall, we can't decide what's more eye catching, the mountain views or the interior design. Working with a challenging space or can't find the perfect piece of furniture? Email info@projectsunday.net to set up a meeting with out design team.
results.blockquote_text: The benches, built without leg supports are all cleverly engineered with strong sub structures that secure firmly to the walls. The solid walnut sectional with adjustable brass shelving running from the back to the ceiling is a favorite of ours and just through the kitchen area.

results.short_description: Custom built office furniture at the top of the Redman Building. Good views inside and out.
results.project_copy: The Utah Windemere Real Estate team relocated a few years ago into a beautiful office building with, arguably, some of the best views of our nearby mountain ranges and city. We were commissioned to build custom curved desks in their loft style offices. The dark stained reclaimed oak and steel really added a nice tone to the white walls and concrete floor. Not shown are the handful of freestanding Alder desks made with solid wood desktops, 3"x1" raw steel perimeter bases, and a clever floating filing cabinet system. Custom office furniture goes a long way in truly representing a brand and is an easy way to set yourself apart. Contact info@projectsunday.net to set up an office design consultation.
results.blockquote_text: We were commissioned to build custom curved desks in their loft style offices. The dark stained reclaimed oak and steel really added a nice tone to the white walls and concrete floor.

results.short_description: Custom waiting room displays and magazine racks.
results.project_headline: Like a mullet: Modern in the front. Rustic in the back.
results.project_copy: Another longtime friend, Ulysses is located near our old stomping grounds. Due to neighborly respect, we bonded with owner Andrew Valtal and have become closer than mere party warnings. He asked to have some product shelving designed and built that would reflect what was going on in the salon: classic beauty mixed with an edgy sex appeal. The reception area's eclectic style is anchored by a sleek walnut shelving unit to hold all the potions and elixirs to make your hair dreams come true. The reclaimed wall behind the front desk has a more playful flavor with incorporated shelves for featured products. Both compliment one another nicely. If it's time to remove that mullet and make your dreams come true email info@projectsunday.net.

results.short_description: An attractive combination of white shaker cabinets and concrete countertops.
results.project_copy: We have done kitchen design and remodels, but usually prefer to leave large swaths of cabinetry to the professionals...This one, on the other hand, was a necessity. The,"Yes Mom, I'll make you a new kitchen!" kind of necessity. Built in Utah then transported 1300 miles to Missouri, the design turned out beautifully. The white shaker style cabinetry and the natural concrete countertops work well together. Turns out, we are professionals, and are willing to work on a kitchen from time to time.
results.blockquote_text: We have done kitchen design and remodels, but usually prefer to leave large swaths of cabinetry to the professionals...This one, on the other hand, was a necessity.

materials_used.name: Concrete
materials_used.copy: A heavy, rough building material made from a mixture of broken stone or gravel, sand, cement, and water, that can be spread or poured into molds.

results.short_description: A residential bar better than most established ones we frequent.
results.project_headline: Found our host for the next big game.
results.project_copy: Living Home Construction had been remodeling a house in Park City and needed some assistance with a custom ceiling mosaic made of darkened steel. Their design of the downstairs bar area was wonderful. The accompaniment of quality lighting, glass wine storage, solid wood cabinetry and stacked stone walls created an ideal residential entertainment area. Our ceiling tiles added just another subtle detail of a fine mixture of materials and tones.
results.blockquote_text: The accompaniment of quality lighting, glass wine storage, solid wood cabinetry and stacked stone walls created an ideal residential entertainment area.

results.short_description: Quality built restaurant server station and espresso bar.
results.project_copy: Rachel Hodson of Stunning Dismount hired us to help design and build a few crucial pieces at Copper Common, a local cocktail bar and restaurant. We worked to come up with efficient furniture that would stand up to the constant abuse of restaurant demand. The cabinetry and countertops of both the server station and espresso bar were made using white oak (for its water resistant properties) then properly sealed with a food grade finish. The top shelving portion was the interesting part: Rachel was able to get copper tubing milled out to house LED light strips. Copper is a soft, malleable metal, so we were interested to see if it would support all the intended glassware. It turned out to be as solid as steel. If you are planning to open a restaurant in, email info@projectsunday.net for some quality, long lasting interior pieces.
results.blockquote_text: We worked to come up with efficient furniture that would stand up to the constant abuse of restaurant demand.
